alert.note: Alert for Indian River; Martin; Okeechobee; St. Lucie (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 12 at 12:27PM EST by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of St. Lucie, eastern Okeechobee, southern Indian River and northeastern Martin Counties through 115 PM EST... At 1227 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms capable of producing a landspout along a line extending from near Fellsmere to 6 miles west of Okeechobee. Movement was northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts, winds in excess of 40 mph, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Port Saint Lucie, Walton, Fort Pierce, Stuart and Vero Beach. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 PM EST for east central Florida.

area.areaDesc: Indian River; Martin; Okeechobee; St. Lucie
